description: Enhanced food security and nutritional status in the region.
Strengthened resilience of communities to climate change.
Increased adoption of sustainable agricultural practices by farmers.
Improved maternal and child health outcomes in target villages.
Reduced incidence of waterborne diseases in the community.
Construct 15 new community water wells and sanitation facilities.
Train 250 local farmers in climate-resilient farming techniques.
Deliver health and nutrition training to 50 community health workers.
Procure and distribute drought-resistant seeds to beneficiaries.
Conduct monthly health check-up camps for pregnant women and infants.
Develop and disseminate information, education, and communication (IEC) materials on hygiene.
Identify and enroll participants for business management workshops.
